title: When quiet came

abstract: In the evening of the 15th February, things became silent. That night we were taken as prisoners of war by the Japanese
description: Bill Flowers tells his story of how he was captured by the Japanese and sent to Changi as a POW. His tale is one of survival. Bill was in the 2/9th Field Ambulance during World War II. This digital story was recorded as part of In Our Words : Stories from Victorian Veterans digital storytelling workshop
